title: In Baniyas, Syria, the story of a Sunni who saved Alawites from massacre: 'We acted out of simple humanity'
summary: In the district of Baniyas, executions perpetrated against Alawites by Sunni factions caused around 100 deaths. A man in his sixties hid several Alawite families in his apartment in a Sunni neighborhood in the city center.

title: US flies alleged gang members to El Salvador despite court block
summary: The deportations took place despite a US federal judge granting a temporary suspension of the expulsions order, apparently as planes were headed to El Salvador. The move raised questions over whether the Trump administration deliberately defied the court decision.

title: The threats to public health in Trump's US
summary: Massive cuts in federal agency staff, funding suspended or cancelled, data made inaccessible: the 47th president of the US has plunged the world of science into chaos, without sparing the biomedical sphere. The fightback is getting organized, notably around the 'Stand Up for Science' movement.

title: Israel: Netanyahu seeks to fire internal security agency chief
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that he was seeking to dismiss Shin Bet head Ronen Bar. The internal security agency chief swiftly called the move political and said the premier expected 'personal loyalty'.

title: DRC's Goma, after the M23 attack: a city at a standstill and cut off from the world
summary: The economy of the North Kivu capital, seized by the rebel movement and its Rwandan allies in late January, has ground to a halt due to the airport's closure and the paralysis of the banking system.

title: Belgian actress Emilie Dequenne dead at 43
summary: Her first role in 'Rosetta', by the Dardenne brothers, launched her career after she won best actress at the Cannes Film Festival for her performance in the film, which also won the Palme d'Or.

title: Yemen Houthi rebels say they attacked US carrier after air strikes
summary: The Iran-backed group said they had launched 18 missiles and a drone at the US aircraft carrier USS Harry Truman and its accompanying warships, in response to US strikes on Saturday. There was no immediate comment from the United States about the claim.

title: Vatican releases first photo of Pope Francis in over a month
summary: In a message earlier on Sunday, the pope said he was 'facing a period of trial' and thanked well-wishers.

title: Belgrade's historic day of anger: Hundreds of thousands of Serbians protest for 'laws and justice that work'
summary: The country's authoritarian president, Aleksandar Vucic, was the protestors' main target at the large anti-corruption demonstration, following the fatal accident at the Novi Sad train station. Saturday's movement was reminiscent of those that led to the fall of former dictator Slobodan Milosevic in 2000.

title: In the US, some Democrats step back from gender and minority issues
summary: Following the example of California Governor Gavin Newsom, many Democrats are distancing themselves from the party's usual position on minority rights issues.

title: Polish far right picks up steam as presidential election approaches
summary: Slawomir Mentzen, the far-right Konfederacja alliance candidate, is polling at 22% ahead of the Polish presidential election on May 18.

title: Gad Elmaleh: 'I'm at a point in my life where I have a more selfish desire to leave a mark'
summary: Driven by a desire to pass on and discover new talent, the 53-year-old comedian and actor talks to Le Monde about why he is getting involved in new stand-up venues.

title: Architect in charge of Nice contemporary art museum's renovation dismissed
summary: The city has parted company with Portuguese architect Joao Luis Carrilho da Graça, who was chosen to redevelop the MAMAC. He is contesting the decision before an administrative court.

title: Nightclub fire in North Macedonia kills at least 59, wounds more than 150
summary: The fire broke out early Sunday in the eastern town of Kocani during a concert by a local pop group, according to the interior minister. Pyrotechnics caused the roof to catch fire, he said.

title: French MEP says US should give back Statue of Liberty
summary: Raphaël Glucksmann, a center-left member of the European Parliament, has strongly criticized President Donald Trump's radical change of US policy on the war in Ukraine.

title: Matteo Jorgenson retains title in Paris-Nice race
summary: The American rider, who lives in Nice, won the eight-day race ahead of German hope Florian Lipowitz and Dutch climber Thymen Arensman.

title: Maria Mazzotta's punk-rock tarantellas
summary: The Italian singer with a powerful voice brings her second solo album, 'Onde,' to the French stage.

title: European armies seek to urgently end dependence on US
summary: The wake-up call has been especially brutal for the Europeans, as the war in Ukraine had significantly deepened their dependence on the entire American military system – from fighter jets and satellites to artillery, munitions and telecommunications.

title: French beauty industry fears Washington's wrath
summary: In response to the trade war started by Donald Trump, the European Union is considering taxing make-up products and essential oils from the US. The European cosmetics industry therefore fears it will be targeted by the US president in retaliation.
